{"step_by_step_thinking": "Olaparib is a type of drug known as a PARP inhibitor, which works by preventing cancer cells from repairing their DNA, causing them to die. It has been approved by the FDA for the treatment of certain types of prostate cancer, specifically those with mutations in the BRCA1 or BRCA2 genes. Therefore, it can be effective for treating certain types of prostate cancer.", "answer_choice": "A"}
